definitions.definition: The act of hauling or dragging.
That which is hauled or dragged.
examples: The pack is a heavy lug .

definitions.definition: ( electrical engineering ) A device for terminating an electrical conductor to facilitate the mechanical connection; to the conductor it may be crimped to form a cold weld, soldered or have pressure from a screw.
A part of something which sticks out , used as a handle or support .
A large, clumsy, awkward man; a fool .
( UK ) An ear or ear lobe .
examples: While shaving, the poor sod had a fit and cut part of a lug off.

definitions.definition: A wood box used for transporting fruit or vegetables .
( slang ) A request for money , as for political purposes .
examples: They put the lug on him at the courthouse.

definitions.definition: ( informal ) A pull or drag on a cigarette .

main_definition: The act of hauling or dragging.
secondary_definitions: That which is hauled or dragged.

( electrical engineering ) A device for terminating an electrical conductor to facilitate the mechanical connection; to the conductor it may be crimped to form a cold weld, soldered or have pressure from a screw.
A part of something which sticks out , used as a handle or support .
A large, clumsy, awkward man; a fool .
( UK ) An ear or ear lobe .
A wood box used for transporting fruit or vegetables .
( slang ) A request for money , as for political purposes .
( informal ) A pull or drag on a cigarette .

definitions.definition: A measure of length equal to 16 + ⁄ 2 feet .

The leather loop or ear by which a shaft is held up. Harness pendant suspension mount featuring two lugs (at the bottom). The pendant has one lug (also named loop), placed in the gap between the two lugs of the hanger.
A loop (or protuberance ) found on both arms of a hinge , featuring a hole for the axis of the hinge.
A ridge or other protuberance on the surface of a body to increase traction or provide a hold for holding and moving it.

main_definition: ( UK , dialect ) A rod or pole .
secondary_definitions: ( UK , archaic , dialect ) A measure of length equal to 16 + ⁄ 2 feet .

( harness ) The leather loop or ear by which a shaft is held up. Harness pendant suspension mount featuring two lugs (at the bottom). The pendant has one lug (also named loop), placed in the gap between the two lugs of the hanger.
A loop (or protuberance ) found on both arms of a hinge , featuring a hole for the axis of the hinge.
A ridge or other protuberance on the surface of a body to increase traction or provide a hold for holding and moving it.
